title: Canberra distance
summary: The Canberra distance is a numerical measure of the distance between pairs of points in a vector space, introduced in 1966[1] and refined in 1967[2] by Godfrey N. Lance and William T. Williams. It is a weighted version of L‚ÇÅ (Manhattan) distance.[3] The Canberra distance has been used as a metric for comparing ranked lists[3] and for intrusion detection in computer security.[4] It has also been used to analyze the gut microbiome in different disease states.[5]
